title: Joni Ernst
added: In May 2020, she praised Trump's response to the coronavirus pandemic, saying, "Generally, I feel [Trump’s] done a very good job. He was right on it from day one prohibiting travel from certain countries and so forth. I think it was the right thing to do."<ref>{{Cite web|title=Republicans praise Trump's pandemic response with Senate majority at risk|url=https://www.politico.com/news/2020/05/06/senate-republicans-trump-coronavirus-response-240454|access-date=2020-05-07|website=POLITICO|language=en}}</ref>

In August 2020, while Iowa had the most new virus cases per capita of any state, Ernst pushed conspiracy theories that coronavirus case numbers were greatly inflated and that health care providers might be falsifying coronavirus cases.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Epstein|first=Reid J.|date=2020-09-02|title=2020 Election Live Updates: New Poll Shows Biden’s Lead Over Trump Narrowing in Pennsylvania|language=en-US|work=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/09/02/us/trump-vs-biden|access-date=2020-09-02|issn=0362-4331}}</ref>

title: Joni Ernst
deleted: In December 2018, Ernst voted to confirm [[Kathy Kraninger]] as the next Director of the [[Consumer Financial Protection Bureau]] in a decisive vote. The measure ultimately cleared the [[United States Senate]] chamber with all 50 present Republicans voting in favor of the confirmation and all 49 Democrats voting in opposition.<ref>{{cite web |title=On the Nomination (Confirmation Kathleen Laura Kraninger, of Ohio, to be Director of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection ) |url=https://www.senate.gov/legislative/LIS/roll_call_lists/roll_call_vote_cfm.cfm?congress=115&session=2&vote=00255 |website=Roll Call Vote 115th Congress - 2nd Session |publisher=United States Senate |accessdate=6 February 2019}}</ref>

title: Joni Ernst
added: Ernst supports eliminating the [[United States Department of Education|U.S. Department of Education]] and the [[Environmental Protection Agency]], while opposing the [[Affordable Care Act]], a [[Minimum wage in the United States|federal minimum wage]], access to [[abortion]], and [[net neutrality]]. She has claimed ignorance of the scientific consensus on [[climate change]] and supported U.S. withdrawal from the [[Paris Agreement|Paris climate accords]].

Ernst has been characterized as a fairly reliable ally of [[Donald Trump]], and was speculated as a possible vice presidential pick during his [[Donald Trump 2016 presidential campaign|2016 campaign]].

title: Joni Ernst
added: [[MSNBC]] described Ernst as "arguably the most extremist candidate to seek statewide office in 2014".<ref>{{cite web |last1=Benen |first1=Steve |title=The 'perfect choice' to serve as the voice of the 2015 GOP |url=https://www.msnbc.com/rachel-maddow-show/the-perfect-choice-serve-the-voice-the-2015-gop-msna506131 |website=[[MSNBC]] |language=en |date=January 15, 2015}}</ref>
